displaytitle: Mounted Men in a Circular Formation
medium: Pen and brown ink with black chalk
creditline: Gift of Alexander P. Morgan, Class of 1922, and Sarah Breese

titles.title: Mounted Men in a Circular Formation

texts.textentryhtml:
Felton Gibbons states: "These drawings [x1936-7a-k]...were formerly considered to be by Callot.  In a letter of July 1948 Edwin DeT. Bechtel retained the Callot attribution [for this drawing]. Daniel Ternois in a letter of July 1956 modified this suggestion in a manner reflecting the consistent style of the group, which he attributed entirely to Della Bella, a judgment in which Pierre Rosenberg later concurred.  This revision certainly seems correct in view of the style and graphology of all these drawings.

Adapted from  Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian drawings in the Art Museum, Princeton University (Princeton, Princeton University Press, 1977).

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: pp. 19-20, no. 48 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)

caption: Stefano Della Bella (Italian, 1610–1664), Mounted Men in a Circular Formation. Pen and brown ink with black chalk; 5.8 cm. Gift of Alexander P. Morgan, Class of 1922, and Sarah Breese (x1936-7 g)
